alert.note: Alert for Weld (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 05 at 5:40PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM MDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Hydrologic flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Colorado, including the near and along the Cache La Poudre River in Weld County. * WHEN...Until 100 PM MDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Sections of the Poudre River Trail begin to overtop from Windsor to Greeley. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 539 PM MDT, gauge reports indicated earlier heavy rain produced increased flows in the river. Heavy rainfall is possible over the upstream tributaries this evening. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... along the Cache La Poudre River.
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads or bike through flooded bike trails.
